content.description: Nice little warm up. Used primarily for the down climb after toping out on the opposing side. Freshly cleaned of moss and soil when I was on it, so very slippery.
content.location: Right side of the boulder when looking up hill at the front. Obviously slabbing section

content.description: Sit start with two obviously pockets. reach for the horizontal cracks. Jugs for the top out.
content.location: just down from the back of the boulder.

content.description: First problem left of the slab. Weird start. Attempted multiple times. Undercling on each side fo the Arete. Low feet. Sketchy top out.
content.location: Just left of slippery when left.

content.description: Start with a thin left hand.  Right hold is shared with "can I put my hand in here. Again, near horizontal sit start. Bump up to the pockets in the horizontal crack, or pinches. Far reach to the jug for the top ou.
content.location: In front of the two trees to the right of the boulder.

climbs.name: Can I put my Hand in here??

content.description: Near horizontal start with the holds I used, which I would say makes it the V2, otherwise probably V1 from there. Shares The right start hold of "Happy Dollar in your Pocket". Plenty of holds to bump hands to. Far reach for a Jug for the top out.
content.location: Right in front of the two trees near the front of the boulder

content.description:
It its a well traveled road due to Sullivan Falls. I am not sure how many cars actually slow down or stop on the road. People seemed to slow down near my car, either in confusion makes its in the middle of the woods or concern. Either way, there is no specific trail (yet) to the boulder. It was an easy ~0.5 mile bushwhack to the boulder. Most of my time was spent cleaning the route and mainly the top of the boulder for top out.  

  Be sure to bring brushes. maybe a bulldozer broom or rack to make clear the top out a little better.  

  If staring at the front of the boulder from where you parked, there is another boulder about ~0.25 miles uphill and to the right that potential. Very Mossy and I just did not have time to climb it.
